page.title: 19The Village School
page.content: St. Mary's School in Askham Richard is a Church of England primary school. It was built in the 1890s and modernised and extended in the 1970s. The school takes children from Askham Richard and others are brought,by car or bus, from Askham Bryan. In 1985 the school has thirty four pupils. There are two classes:an infant class for five to seven year olds and a junior class for those between eight and eleven years. When the children leave this school they go to a comprehensive school in Tadcaster. There is a headmistress who teaches the junior class and a teacher responsible for the infant class. A part time teacher spends nine hours a week in the school.
